title: Solving Bengaluru’s parking puzzle
description: While paid parking is being introduced on more stretches and towing is set to make a comeback, Chetan B.C. explores if these measures are enough to solve Bengaluru’s traffic maze

title: Stray dogs at the centre of a growing social divide
description: Villages across Telangana are reporting mass killing of stray dogs with alarming regularity. As fear and frustration mount, stray dog management has turned into a flashpoint, with gram panchayats seeking swift remedies and courts weighing empathy against public safety, writes Swathi Vadlamudi

title: Colleges within schools
description: From just a couple of government colleges in 1966, the year Haryana was formed, the State now has 186. The policy of every school graduate having access to a college within 20 km propelled Haryana into number-driven growth over the past five years. On ground though, Ashok Kumar finds that many colleges are run from school buildings, there are few courses on offer, and an acute shortage of teaching staff leaves students at a disadvantage

title: Virat Kohli Insta disappears; fans flood Anushka Sharma’s posts
description: Cricket fans are buzzing on Anushka Sharma's social media, curious about the sudden absence of Virat Kohli's Instagram account. Theories of a possible break or temporary suspension are swirling, prompting many to express their worries and implore the actress to encourage her husband to rejoin the digital landscape. So far, neither Kohli nor Sharma has commented on this intriguing situation.

description: A couple died and their three children were found poisoned in Greater Noida's Ecotech 3 area. The children, aged 10, 8, and 4, are now out of danger after hospitalisation. Preliminary investigations suggest the couple may have consumed poison due to domestic issues.

title: ‘Must be corrected’: Trump threatens Canada with 50% aircraft tariff; dispute over jet certification
description: President Trump has threatened Canada with a 50% tariff on all aircraft sold in the U.S. This retaliatory measure follows Canada's refusal to certify jets from Gulfstream Aerospace. The U.S. also plans to decertify all Canadian aircraft, impacting manufacturers like Bombardier.

title: 'Border 2' box office collection day 7
description: The war drama 'Border 2' has achieved a significant milestone, crossing Rs 300 crore worldwide within its first week of release. Despite a strong opening and impressive weekend collections, the film experienced a drop in weekday earnings but continues to maintain its pace at the box office.

description: Low visibility initiated a series of events leading to the Learjet crash that killed Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar and four others. CCTV footage revealed the aircraft abruptly rolled left and descended near-vertically, suggesting a loss of control at low altitude. Pilots had no time for recovery, with potential causes including engine failure or control surface issues.

description: A hypothetical trade sees the Atlanta Braves acquiring versatile infielder Nico Hoerner from the Chicago Cubs for hard-throwing reliever Robert Suarez. This move addresses Atlanta's infield void due to injury, while Chicago secures a much-needed closer. Both players are in their prime with multi-year control, making it a balanced, win-now exchange.

description: Secretary of War Pete Hegseth issued a stern warning to Iran against developing nuclear weapons, stating the US is prepared to act under President Trump's directives. He highlighted the ongoing military deployment in the Middle East as a demonstration of readiness and deterrence, emphasizing the administration's commitment to preventing a nuclear Iran.

title: Democrats, White House strike spending deal; temporarily avert US government shutdown
description: Democrats and the White House are nearing a spending deal to avert a government shutdown, with negotiations focusing on immigration enforcement limits. A temporary two-week funding extension for Homeland Security is tentatively agreed upon, separating it from the larger spending bill to allow further talks on ICE operations and agent conduct.

title: T20 WC row: 'Nahi khelenge'- Former Pakistan captain floats India match boycott plan
description: Former Pakistan captain Rashid Latif has withdrawn his call for a full T20 World Cup boycott, stating the opportune moment has passed. He now suggests Pakistan could refuse to play India, a decision he insists must come from the government. Latif believes a boycott now would lack impact after Bangladesh's exclusion.

title: Bangladesh crash out of U19 World Cup; BCB flags 'unfair schedule' by ICC
description: Bangladesh's Under-19 World Cup campaign concluded amidst criticism from their cricket board regarding unfair match scheduling and travel arrangements. The BCB highlighted the team's extensive travel, including a nine-hour bus journey, and accused the ICC of ignoring their concerns about the demanding itinerary.

title: 'Wuthering Heights' Twitter reviews HAIL Margot-Jacob's chemistry
description: The atmosphere at the 'Wuthering Heights' premiere is electric, thanks to Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi's sizzling chemistry. Early feedback highlights Emerald Fennell's fearless interpretation as a 'red-hot' and 'intricately twisted' masterpiece, set to deliver a fervent and heartbreakingly immersive viewing journey.

title: After Trump push, Venezuela moves to open oil sector, ending years of state control
description: Venezuela's National Assembly has approved a new law opening its oil sector to private companies. This reverses a policy of state control lasting over 20 years. The law allows private firms to manage oil production and sales. It also permits international arbitration for disputes. Extraction taxes will be adjusted.

title: Baramati plane crash: Neither company nor govt has contacted us, says flight attendant’s family
description: Flight attendant Pinky Mali, who died in a plane crash with Deputy CM Ajit Pawar, was cremated in Dadar. Her father and husband expressed deep hurt over the lack of communication from the airline and government, demanding a thorough investigation. Neighbours remembered Pinky and her husband as a warm couple.

title: WPL 2026: After the de Klerk show, Harris and Smriti take over for RCB
description: The comprehensive eight-wicket victory ensures the Bengaluru team a berth in the final; the U.P. Warriorz batters falter after a 74-run opening partnership between Deepti and Lanning; Smriti’s decision to bowl first justified

title: Dhurandhar OTT release announced makers skip promotions for debut
description: Get ready to binge-watch Ranveer Singh’s 'Dhurandhar' on Netflix! After a staggering Rs 1300 crore at the box office, this gripping espionage thriller is making waves online in Hindi, Tamil, and Telugu. Director Aditya Dhar is thrilled about this new journey for the film, encouraging everyone to join the adventure and uncover the secrets packed into this epic saga.

title: Pregnant SWAT commando murdered by husband; dowry charge added
description: A 24-year-old Delhi Police SWAT commando, Kajal Chaudhary, died after allegedly being attacked by her husband, Ankur Chaudhary. The victim was four months pregnant. Police have added murder and dowry charges after her family alleged harassment over dowry. The accused, a clerk in the Union defence ministry, has been suspended.

title: From Boeing 737 examiner to ‘Bunny’: The life of Baramati crash victim Capt. Sumit Kapur
description: Pilot Sumit Kapur, known as "Bunny," died in a charter aircraft crash in Maharashtra. A respected examiner with 20,000 flight hours, Kapur was remembered for his warmth and precision by family and colleagues.

Giannis Antetokounmpo ruled out for Bucks vs. Wizards tonight
description: Milwaukee's superstar Giannis Antetokounmpo is sidelined with a right calf strain, ruling him out of tonight's game against the Washington Wizards. This isn't a game-time decision; he's officially out for several weeks, impacting the Bucks' offensive firepower and defensive presence.  His absence significantly alters betting lines and fantasy projections for the team.

description: Brooks Koepka has returned to the PGA Tour at the Farmers Insurance Open after leaving LIV Golf. Despite facing penalties, his focus remains steady. His wife, Jena Sims Koepka, marked the moment with a simple message while highlighting family first. Fatherhood has changed Koepka, but his drive to win majors remains strong.

This prediction is part of a Fanatics partnership that will donate $1 million to charity, regardless of the game's outcome.

description: Dwyane Wade and his wife, the popular actress Gabrielle Union, have had a beautiful and a healthy marriage ever since they tied the knot in 2014.While things have always been good between them, Gabrielle Union went through a traumatic struggles as she tried to conceive their baby early on in their marriage. Unfortunately, the popular actress went through a number of miscarriages and had to opt for surrogacy later. While the miscarriages affected her health, Gabrielle Union opened up how it changed her relationship with Dwyane Wade.

American Airlines plans to resume flights, reconnecting families and fostering business between the nations after a diplomatic breakdown in 2019.
